TopicTitle: The Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (CKAN) Package Manager; v1.18.0 [19 June 2016]

Articles.Content:
same (presumably) false positive on the latest version:

https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/95ea198e702c145ab21ad30e7e4e73a40bae4d86d87c5e03ef150cbf7b505f23/analysis/1430110242/

That doesn't sound good. Would you please open a github issue on the matter so we can track it better. https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/new

Loaded up the new version, with no problems, now i am just waiting for the catalog to get updated as mods get updated to 1.0 versions, sigh game breaking updates, guess i have to go do somehting in the real world now.....how boring, you can't mod the real world.....not really.

There seems to be about 85 mods available for 1.0

Not bad considering it launched an hour or two ago.

EDIT :

One question though. How easy would it be for mods to have an entry for Dev versions? I'm thinking specifically of Mechjeb which has many versions between releases put up on GitHub but only the main one shows in CKAN.

There is a dev version for 1.0 up already although it's not perfect according to reports. It would still be nice to install it with CKAN and be notified of updates to the Dev version instead of always having it reported as updated as the .Dll has been spotted but not installed by CKAN and having to spot updates the 'old fashioned way'.

Edited April 27, 2015 by John FX
Many of those 85 aren't actually compatible though, and it's missing some of the few that are compatible (most of RoverDude's stuff, for instance).

There seems to be about 85 mods available for 1.0

Not bad considering it launched an hour or two ago.

EDIT :

One question though. How easy would it be for mods to have an entry for Dev versions? I'm thinking specifically of Mechjeb which has many versions between releases put up on GitHub but only the main one shows in CKAN.

There is a dev version for 1.0 up already although it's not perfect according to reports. It would still be nice to install it with CKAN and be notified of updates to the Dev version instead of always having it reported as updated as the .Dll has been spotted but not installed by CKAN and having to spot updates the 'old fashioned way'.

Dev versions of MJ are available, just add the MJ-DEV repo through the Settings menu.

Many of those 85 aren't actually compatible though, and it's missing some of the few that are compatible (most of RoverDude's stuff, for instance).

Many of the partmods have chosen to be compatible with ksp_version_min fields and as such shows up. RoverDudes mods where just indexed but not all dependencies are met yet, esspecially ModuleManager (which will be out soon) is missing atm. Sarbian is being a champ though and MM will soon be available.

Just a small sanity check, does every mod available through CKAN reside in it's own GameData/xxx folder (minus the DLLs, which are in GameData itself), and never in the vanilla folders or elsewhere ?

If so, this means I can update KSP through it's launcher safely and have a clean install (minus the mods in GameData) and then sort through those and update them. Correct ?
Ah, gotcha, the dependencies thing makes sense. I was thrown by Karbonite+ showing up even though its dependencies weren't there.

FWIW Last I checked treeloader has been broken since 0.24, and has been superseded by Techmanager, which itself is now likely obsolete with the new tech tree system in 1.0. May be time to remove it from the CKAN repo.

Just a small sanity check, does every mod available through CKAN reside in it's own GameData/xxx folder (minus the DLLs, which are in GameData itself), and never in the vanilla folders or elsewhere ?

If so, this means I can update KSP through it's launcher safely and have a clean install (minus the mods in GameData) and then sort through those and update them. Correct ?

Some mods also put things into the Ships folder and there are other folders which mods are allowed to install to through CKAN but I can't say I've ever seen an example of a mod adding stuff to another place than GameData or Ships. I'm acctually not sure how CKAN would handle the update since you'll most probably be stuck with a bunch of outdated mods. My, limited, experience with CKAN handling mods not available for your version of the game is that it marks them as AD and then you can't update/interact with them any more. You could always do a backup and then try, that's the best way of finding out in this case

Ah, gotcha, the dependencies thing makes sense. I was thrown by Karbonite+ showing up even though its dependencies weren't there.

I've hopefully merged everything needed to resolve the USI mods not showing up in CKAN now. CRP was stuck at 0.90 due to an indexing problem but it should be reindexed within the hour when the bot finds it.

additionally i am now getting errors when trying to update mods, oh well i know pjf will fix it soon

edit: using KSP 1.0

Our metadata is generated in different ways for different sources and the methods have evolved over time. This means that some of the older indexed versions have much less restrictive versionfields defined than the newer ones making them show up now.

The CKAN developers are all volounteers and we're doing our very best to keep up with the onslaught of mods currently requireing varying degrees of pokes and prods to be correctly indexed. The work being done now will hopefully make the next major transition easier.

To all who are having issues with the error on startup, use this workaround:

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN-support/issues/113#issuecomment-96232753
